column4: where is the setting for changing the number of works spaces?
but it says I only have 1 workspace
but now I dont have a title bar on any window :-/
damn I hate being a noob
well im going to try and uninstall it real quick.....is compiz like a equivelant?
if that doens't work, right click the Beryl Manager icon, and, pardon me, i forget the details, but in one of the little menu's, it might have an option for what Window Decorator to use

Compiz is more stable, but lacks a few of the feautures Beryl has. HOWEVER, recently, Compiz and Beryl reunited, and formed Compiz-Fusion. I would define Compiz-Fusion as "kickass", but it's harder to install
did my earlier messages help at all?
Okay, here's your last ditch option.
Which one do you want working, Compiz or Beryl?
in that case, start Desktop Effects and see if it works

To get the Window Manager working (assuming you have 3D capable video card), open up gConf-Editor with Alt-F2, and by typing "gconf-editor". Go under Apps > Beryl > General > plugins > decoration > allscreens > options, and on the right, for "command", enter gtk-window-decorator
Then in my above post, change the word "beryl" to "compiz"
then something's really not working :P restart X with Ctrl Alt Backspace, and don't use compiz or Beryl is all I can say
it wouldn't eliminate any of your data, but all your configurations and stuff would be restored to when you first installed
